item.title: Report I-2024060023
item.description:
Report I-2024060023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 05/19/2024, during boarding phase of flight DL453(ATL-SAN), a passengefs bag in the overhead bin at seat 10C was observed to be smoking along with a loud"pop" noise. The bag was removed and placed in the jetway where AFD discovered that the heat source was a camera battery. AFD extinguished the battery and TechOps was tasked with disposal. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No Flight Crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report E-2024060051
item.description:
Report E-2024060051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: MCCAYSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fuel spill was from the tractor FUEL tank and not the DOT 406 trailer vessel. Reporting as a precaution due to the cleanup involved. Driver was backing due to be re-routed by law enforcement. Stuck a guardrail with the fuel tank on the tractor resulting in a spill of diesel fuel. CDG was contacted and managed the cleanup. Again, NO damage to the DOT 406 trailer. No release from the trailer or the fuel that was being transported by Eagle.
